message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.NE, cs.DS 

This paper deals with reinforcement learning algorithms with linear function approximation, which is a topic that falls under the subfield of machine learning. Specifically, the paper focuses on a class of RL methods called natural algorithms, which are characterized as the fixed point of a projected Bellman equation. This places the paper within the subfield of RL and optimization. The paper also discusses the convergence of these algorithms and the conditions under which they converge, which is a topic that falls under the subfield of theoretical computer science. Based on these factors, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.SY (Systems and Control), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
